nodes.title: TSMC
nodes.short_description: Leading foundry rival; shapes pricing, technology roadmaps, and major customers' allocation away from Samsung.

nodes.title: SK Hynix
nodes.short_description: Fierce memory competitor, influencing DRAM/HBM pricing, capex cycles, and market share.

nodes.title: Micron Technology
nodes.short_description: Key DRAM/NAND competitor affecting pricing, supply discipline, and industry profitability.

nodes.title: Qualcomm
nodes.short_description: Supplies modems/SoCs and licenses IP, affecting Samsung smartphone performance, costs, and market timing.

nodes.title: Google
nodes.short_description: Controls Android and GMS ecosystem, dictating features, compliance, and revenue-sharing terms for Galaxy devices.

nodes.title: ASML
nodes.short_description: Sole EUV supplier; tool availability dictates Samsung advanced-node timing and yields.

nodes.title: NVIDIA
nodes.short_description: Major buyer of HBM and memory; demand drives pricing and capacity decisions.

nodes.title: Huawei
nodes.short_description: Major smartphone competitor; sanctions and recovery directly shift Samsung's market share, especially in China.

nodes.title: China
nodes.short_description: Critical market and manufacturing base; regulations and demand swings heavily influence sales and supply chains.

nodes.title: South Korea
nodes.short_description: Home market and policy hub; incentives, regulations, and labor decisions directly affect operations.

nodes.title: U.S. semiconductor export controls on China (2022â€“)
nodes.short_description: Restrictions reshape equipment access, customer eligibility, and China-related revenue.

nodes.title: CHIPS and Science Act (U.S.)
nodes.short_description: Subsidies and guardrails influence fab investments, location choices, and competitive dynamics.

nodes.title: Lee Jae-yong
nodes.short_description: Executive Chairman; strategic decisions on M&A, capex, and risk tolerance steer Samsung's trajectory.

nodes.title: Memory semiconductors (DRAM, NAND)
nodes.short_description: Core profit driver; cyclicality and HBM transition dictate earnings and investment.

nodes.title: Smartphones
nodes.short_description: Largest consumer business; demand cycles and ASPs determine revenue scale and component sourcing.
